snippet: A report from the chairman of the House Budget Committee finds flaws with almost every attempt the government has made to relieve poverty and its effects since the 1960s.
abstract: Editorial maintains report from Rep Paul Ryan indicting 50 years of government antipoverty efforts is poorly reasoned and factually distorted; holds Republican Party has no interest in repairing flaws in programs like Medicaid and food stamps, but simply wants intellectual cover as it seeks to eliminate as many as possible.
lead_paragraph: A report from the chairman of the House Budget Committee finds flaws with almost every attempt the government has made to relieve poverty and its effects since the 1960s.

headline.main: Mr. Ryan’s Small Ideas on Poverty
